atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities`, and `variants` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the @theme directive to define your project's custom design tokens (colors, fonts, spacing, etc.) in Tailwind CSS v4.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which 'bucket' a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the @config directive to specify which config file Tailwind should use when compiling that CSS file.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the @custom-variant directive to define custom variants in Tailwind CSS v4. For example: @custom-variant dark (&:is(.dark *));

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Use the @variant directive to apply a Tailwind variant to a block of custom CSS in v4.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Use the @source directive to specify additional source paths for Tailwind to scan for class names.

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Use the @utility directive to define custom utilities in Tailwind CSS v4.

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: Use the @plugin directive to load a Tailwind CSS plugin in v4.

atDirectives.name: @import
atDirectives.description: Use @import to include other CSS files. In Tailwind v4, use @import "tailwindcss" to include all of Tailwind's styles.
